item.title: MySQL: Backups, Restorations and Transfers
item.description:
Backups link

mysqldump link

In my opinion, this is THE best method. It’s provided as standard and works very well. However, be careful with large databases. If you have large databases, then look at XtraBackup.

Its use with a shell is as follows (for small databases):

 mysqldump -uUSER -pPASSWORD -e --single-transaction --opt DATABASE > backup-`date +%y%m%d`.sql

To back up all databases at once:

 mysqldump -uUSER -pPASSWORD --all-databases > backup-`date +%y%m%d`.sql

item.title: Backups and Restorations with tapes
item.description:
Introduction link

A crucial function of system administration is to backup file systems. Backups safeguard against data loss, damage, or corruption. Backup tapes are often referred to as dump tapes.

rmt device link

All tape drives have logical device names that you use to reference the device on the command line. The image shows the format that all logical device names use.

 /dev/rmt/#hn
  • # : Logical Tape number
  • h : Tape density (l,m,h,c,u)
  • No rewind
